title: In museums, Islam broadens its horizons
summary: Islamic civilization is expanding its forms of expression to counter outdated perceptions, biases and current events.

title: How Germany, once a model for welcoming refugees, switched to border control
summary: At Angela Merkel's initiative, Germany welcomed more than a million refugees from Syria and Iraq between 2015 and 2016 with the approval of almost the entire political spectrum and the rallying of public opinion. However, public support quickly waned and the far right capitalized on the backlash against this policy.

title: Harris' latest interview gets combative as Trump gives rare compliments about his opponent
summary: Harris had a hard time finishing her arguments as she and interviewer Bret Baier sparred during the 30-minute interview on Fox News, with Baier talking over a lot of her responses. At a Miami event, Trump was asked to name things he likes about Harris.

title: EU announces 30-million-euro package to prevent irregular migration from Senegal
summary: The European Commission already funds a 5.75-million-euro project strengthening the capacity of Senegalese security forces to combat irregular immigration, trafficking and migrant smuggling.

title: Israel carries out dozens of strikes on Hezbollah targets in Lebanon
summary: Lebanese Prime Minister Najib Mikati condemned the attack, saying Israel 'deliberately targeted a meeting of the municipal council that was discussing the city's services and relief situation.'

title: One Direction ex-singer Liam Payne falls to death at Argentina hotel
summary: The 31-year-old solo artist, who rose to fame with the boy band in 2010 after appearing on the British show 'The X Factor,' fell from the third floor of a hotel in Buenos Aires on Wednesday, a police statement said.

title: How cities are fighting noise pollution, which can have an 'impact on mood'
summary: Noise pollution costs €147 billion a year, according to the French Agency for Environmental Transition. In Rezé (Loire-Atlantique), Nice and Paris, local authorities are stepping up initiatives to better consider and combat noise pollution.

title: Armenia takes partial control of its borders for the first time in 32 years
summary: The Russians, who have guarded the borders of this Caucasus country since 1992, will partially withdraw on January 1, 2025. An important step for Yerevan, which is trying to reduce Moscow's influence.

title: In the Central African Republic, 'They say their peacekeepers came to protect us, but they rape us'
summary: Together with The New Humanitarian, Le Monde has collected stories from 19 women, victims of sexual abuse by MINUSCA troops. Unsure of what to do, doubting support and fearing reprisals, many haven't reported their assaults.

title: Anti-whaling activist Paul Watson asks France for political asylum
summary: Paul Watson wrote in a letter to Emmanuel Macron 'asking for political asylum' in France, according to the head of Sea Shepherd France.

title: 'Ukraine's defeat, if Trump were elected, would also be Europe's defeat'
summary: If elected, the former Republican president would want to settle the Ukrainian conflict directly with Vladimir Putin. This is a major challenge, for which Europe is not prepared, warns Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: French budget: The right pushes for privatizations
summary: To reduce the French government's debt, some conservative leaders are suggesting selling off certain public shareholdings. Meanwhile, the government is considering investing in the company that manufactures France's beloved painkiller, Doliprane.

title: Indian youth's craving for global pop's big live shows
summary: The announcement of Coldplay's visit to Bombay led to many tickets being sold on the black market, illustrating the public's new appetite for American and European artists, who still rarely perform in the country.

title: France bans Israeli booths and equipment from defense show
summary: The Euronaval defense show, taking place in France on November 4, has barred Israeli delegations from setting up stands or exhibiting military hardware, citing 'the French government's decision.'

title: 'Macron's lack of budgetary control turned his adventure into adventurism'
summary: By putting an end to supply-side policies, the 2025 budget bill effectively marks the end of Macron's policy, which he had set up as an alternative to the right and left's economic policies, writes columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Russia: The fragile memory of journalist Irina Slavina
summary: Four years ago, the head of a local investigative website, harassed by the police and the law, died through self-immolation. Today, her family and friends in Nizhny Novgorod are fighting against public apathy and pressure from the authorities to keep her memory alive.

title: Luxury giant LVMH experiences unprecedented drop in sales
summary: Faced with a depressed luxury goods market, the sector's global leader has published a fall in revenue for the first time since 2020. Cost-cutting measures are already underway.

title: Macron-Netanyahu tensions escalate after French president's comments on the creation of Israel
summary: President Emmanuel Macron has been quoted as saying that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu should 'not forget that his country was created by a UN decision.'

title: In northern France, male cheerleaders taunt sexism with pompoms
summary: Providing the entertainment at women's roller derby competitions, they aim to combat stereotypes by adopting the choreography and codes of this culture, which originated in the United States.

title: Immigration takes center stage once again at the European Council's autumn meeting
summary: Amid Italy sending asylum seekers to Albania and Poland aiming to partly suspend the right to asylum, Ursula von der Leyen has proposed that EU countries consider 'innovative ways' to prevent irregular entries.

title: Canada accuses India of criminal activity on its soil
summary: The diplomatic crisis that began in 2023 with the murder of a Sikh separatist in Vancouver has intensified with the reciprocal expulsion of high-ranking diplomats.

title: 305 million years ago, a 2.6-meter-long centipede
summary: For a long time, we didn't know what the head of Arthropleura looked like. Analysis of the animal's first complete fossil, discovered in Saône-et-Loire, sheds light on 150 years of mystery.

title: NATO set to consider Ukraine's 'victory plan'
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is due to present his 'victory plan' to NATO defense ministers in Brussels, despite US and German opposition to Ukraine's immediate entry into the alliance.

title: Trump appears more extremist than ever in final campaign stretch
summary: Surrounded by the US justice system, the Republican candidate is prepared to tell any lie to avoid his own political demise before the November election.

title: 'I was a rag doll': A gang rape survivor speaks out
summary: In March 2020, Milly was sexually assaulted by several individuals, after being abandoned by her friends on a housing estate outside Paris, 400km from home. She has decided to tell her story 'for the other girls to whom this happens.'

title: 'We spent a lot.' How Macron's second term led to France's budget crisis
summary: A parliamentary inquiry commission will look into the country's 'public finance slippage.' It will have to retrace the chain of errors and political decisions that led to 2024's predicted 6.1% deficit.

title: Zelensky defends 'victory plan' at EU and NATO
summary: The Ukrainian president said that his country must be in a position of strength before any peace talks with Russia.

title: Body of missing French teenager found after 13-month search
summary: Police had been searching for the 15-year-old – referred to only as 'Lina' in French media – since her mysterious disappearance on September 23 last year.

title: Afghanistan: 'How to conceive relations with a regime that locks up women?'
summary: Under the Taliban regime, once again in power in Kabul, Afghan women are taken hostage. But little was said about this collective kidnapping during the autumn session of the UN General Assembly, notes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Biden set to make farewell trip to Germany
summary: Amid the backdrop of conflicts in Ukraine and the Middle East which raged during his term in office, US President Joe Biden is due to head to Germany for talks with NATO leaders, ahead of a tumultuous US election.

title: Israeli army says it possibly killed Hamas chief Sinwar in Gaza
summary: Israel accuses 61-year-old Yahya Sinwar of masterminding the October 7, 2023 attack. An Israeli security official reportedly said that DNA testing is underway on a militant's body to confirm if it is Sinwar.
